Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
NAICS Translation: 331419: Primary Smelting and Refining of Nonferrous Metal (except Copper and Aluminum)
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced  that Exide Technologies agreed to settle a lawsuit brought by the United States and the State of Indiana alleging Clean Air Act violations at the companys lead smelter in Muncie, Indiana. Exide Technologies agreed to spend over $3.9 million to install state-of-the-art pollution control equipment to reduce harmful air pollution from the facility. The settlement resolved claims that the facility's failure to comply with national emission standards resulted in the release of excess lead in an area that does not meet the federal health-based air quality standard for lead. The settlement also required the company to pay a civil penalty of $820,000.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epa/newsreleases/us-and-indiana-settle-clean-air-act-case-muncie-smelter-reduce-lead-emissions.html

Description: The United States and Exide Technologies reached an agreement that called for the battery manufacturing company to immediately and forever close a battery recycling facility in Vernon and to pay $50 million to clean-up the site and surrounding neighborhoods, which had been affected by environmental toxins for close to a century.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-cdca/pr/exide-technologies-admits-role-major-hazardous-waste-case-and-agrees-permanently-close
https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/813781/000119312503014922/d10k.htm

Description: Exide agreed to pay a $285,000 penalty in settlement of allegations it violated state Hazardous Waste Control Law at its lead-acid battery recycling facility.
Agency: California Department of Toxic Substances Control
Info Source: https://www.envirostor.dtsc.ca.gov/public/eerppublicdocs/2186843693/Exide%5FCEI2014%5FFinalJudg022717%2Epdf

Description: Exide agreed to pay $1,286,373 covering monetary fines, penalties and costs, plus allowed unsecured claims of $79,542 and $632,760 for additional penalties and costs in settlement of allegations it violated multiple hazardous waste regulations with improperly stored waste, lack of safety and monitoring equipment, and unpermitted machinery. It also agreed to set up financial assurance of approximately $38 million for closure and post closure costs, and to pay up to $9 million in off-site corrective actions.
Agency: California Department of Toxic Substances Control
Info Source: https://www.envirostor.dtsc.ca.gov/public/eerppublicdocs/5610517203/Exide%5FFCI2014%5FStipOrder112114%2Epdf

Agency: California Department of Toxic Substances Control
Info Source: https://www.envirostor.dtsc.ca.gov/public/eerppublicdocs/9355756461/Exide%5FENF%5FSO%2D2013%2Epdf
